Title: Relates to the conditional examination of seniors before trial and a senior's participation in grand jury proceedings
Summary: Allows for the conditional examination of victims who are at least 75 years of age; amends the definition of larceny to ensure that alleged consent by a victim who is mentally disabled is a not a defense to larceny; permits a caregiver to accompany a vulnerable victim into the grand jury.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the criminal procedure law, in relation to conditional examination of seniors before trial and a senior's participation in grand jury proceedings; and to amend the penal law, in relation to defenses to larceny when the victim is mentally disabled
